Description: Upper body and handle root sherd (with turn of rim) of South Ionian pottery little master cup; interior: glazed black at junction of rim and body, reserved below with two bands preserved; exterior: reserved at junction of rim and body; below, band with row of added white dots; in handle zone, plastic human left hand with white-dotted black bracelet; at right, black handle root; glazed below.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis (BM Register may suggest the Temenos of Apollo but is not exolicit)
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: The cup was analysed by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, with NAA and the fabric was identified as a chemical singleton. In his catalogue, Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to the South Ionian with everted rim Type 9B. However, in his chart of South Ionian cups, he identifies the sherd as belonging to a Type 9C cup. The curve of the shoulder and the curved junction of the rim and body suggest that the sherd might be better placed within his Type 9B group. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 56 (Singles, Nauk 36))
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 112-3, NAU 71, pl. 15h-i) (p. 52, no. 286)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.758) (Phase 3)
